clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of the Nasal Allergen Provocation Test in Starting and Monitoring Allergen Immunotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of the Nasal Allergen Provocation Test in Starting and Monitoring Allergen Immunotherapy: An Academic Multicentre Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock:
This prospective multicentric academic NAPT study aims to compile a database of all patients who initiate immunotherapy.
The NAPT will take place before, during and after AIT to evaluate the cost and effectiveness of the treatment. The study consists of 4 visits and 2 telephone contacts that are repeated annually for 3 years.
This study will be conducted in 2 hospitals: UZ Leuven and AZ ST. Jan Brugge on the consultation Ear, Nose and Throat Diseases (ENT) and the department of Internal Medicine / Allergology

primary_outcome.measure: The effectiveness of AIT treatment assessed by the change in the blood concentration in total en specific IgE .
primary_outcome.time_frame: before start AIT, every 6 months en after 3 years
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of AIT treatment will be analysed by comparing blood results, assessed by the NAPT tests, before, during (every 6 months after starting AIT) and after end of treatment (approximately 3 years after start-up).

primary_outcome.measure: The effectiveness of AIT treatment assessed by the change in quality of life meassured by the Lebelscore.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start AIT, every 6 months en after 3 years
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of AIT treatment will be analysed by comparing the Lebelscores ,assessed by the NAPT tests, before, during (every 6 months after starting AIT) and after end of treatment (approximately 3 years after start-up). Lebelscore has a range between 0 and 12.

primary_outcome.measure: The effectiveness of AIT treatment assessed by the change in quality of life meassured by the SNOT-22.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start AIT, every 6 months en after 3 years
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of AIT treatment will be analysed by comparing SNOT-22, assessed by the NAPT tests, before, during (every 6 months after starting AIT) and after end of treatment (approximately 3 years after start-up). SNOT-22 is sino-nasal outcome test with 22 items which ranges from 0 to 110.

primary_outcome.measure: The effectiveness of AIT treatment assessed by the change in quality of life meassured by the VAS.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start AIT, every 6 months en after 3 years
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of AIT treatment will be analysed by comparing VAS, assessed by the NAPT tests, before, during (every 6 months after starting AIT) and after end of treatment (approximately 3 years after start-up). The visual analogue scale (VAS) ranges from 0 to 10cm for every item.

primary_outcome.measure: The effectiveness of AIT treatment assessed by the change in quality of life meassured by the TNSS.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start AIT, every 6 months en after 3 years
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of AIT treatment will be analysed by comparing TNSS, assessed by the NAPT tests, before, during (every 6 months after starting AIT) and after end of treatment (approximately 3 years after start-up). Total nasal symptom score (TNSS) ranges from 0 to 12.

primary_outcome.measure: The effectiveness of AIT treatment assessed by the change in quality of life meassured by the ACT.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start AIT, every 6 months en after 3 years
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of AIT treatment will be analysed by comparing ACT, assessed by the NAPT tests, before, during (every 6 months after starting AIT) and after end of treatment (approximately 3 years after start-up). ACT is the Asthma control test with scores between 0 and 25. The higher the score the better.

primary_outcome.measure: The effectiveness of AIT treatment assessed by the change in quality of life meassured by the RQLQ.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start AIT, every 6 months en after 3 years
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of AIT treatment will be analysed by comparing RQLQ, assessed by the NAPT tests, before, during (every 6 months after starting AIT) and after end of treatment (approximately 3 years after start-up). RQLQ is the rhinoconjunctivits quality of life questionnaire with scores between 0 and 168. The higher the score of these questionnaires the more discomfort.

primary_outcome.measure: The effectiveness of AIT treatment assessed by the change in quality of life meassured by the TRE.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start AIT, every 6 months en after 3 years
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of AIT treatment will be analysed by comparing TRE, assessed by the NAPT tests, before, during (every 6 months after starting AIT) and after end of treatment (approximately 3 years after start-up). TRE is the therapeutic response evaluation and will be scored between 'much better' and 'much worse'.

primary_outcome.measure: The effectiveness of AIT treatment assessed by the change in the PNIF value.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start AIT, every 6 months en after 3 years
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of AIT treatment will be analysed by comparing PNIF values assessed by the NAPT tests, before, during (every 6 months after starting AIT) and after end of treatment (approximately 3 years after start-up). PNIF is the peak nasal inspiratory flow with a value between 0 and 370 l/min). The higher the value the less congested the nose is.

secondary_outcome.measure: Calculating the cost savings by desensitizing poly-sensitized patients only to the allergen to which they respond most strongly in the NAPT test.
Calculating the cost savings by timely stopping AIT treatment in non-responders, which we can define as patients who do not experience subjective or objective improvement after 1 year of treatment.

arm_group.description: Patients with persistent or intermittent allergic rhinitis complaints, confirmed by skin prick tests and/or immunocap for specific IgEs, that start with AIT treatment.

intervention.description: NAPT test with airborn allergens ( HDM, Threes, Grasses)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with persistent and intermittent allergic rhinitis who start with AIT treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >18 and â‰¤60 years
- Persistent or intermittent allergic rhinitis complaints, confirmed by SPT and/of immunocap for the specific IgEs.
OR suspected local allergic rhinitis
- Patients who start with AIT treatment
- The patient must be motivated and willing to come to all visits
- The patient must be able to understand and sign the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled asthma
- Conditions affecting the functioning of the immune system (eg: immune deficiencies, malignancies, autoimmune diseases)
- Use of Î²-blockers, immunosuppressants or ACE inhibitors
- Hypersensitivity to aluminum hydroxide and/or hypersensitivity to any of the excipients in AIT
- Anaphylaxis after allergen challenge in the past
- Acute rhinosinusitis in the last 12 weeks
- Recent surgery on the nose and/or paranasal sinuses in the last 12 weeks
- Pregnancy
